info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Berks, Lehigh, northwestern Montgomery, northwestern Bucks and southwestern Northampton Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Claussville to near Reading to Wyomissing. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Reading, Easton, Bethlehem, Pottstown, Forks, Emmaus, Wyomissing, Northampton, Quakertown, Wilson, Hellertown, Birdsboro, Kutztown, Fleetwood, East Greenville, Topton, West Easton, Bally and Bechtelsville. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 36 and 63. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 43 and 76. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 9 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
